<ce:section-title id="sect0065">Preparations of complex 3</ce:section-title><ce:para id="p0075" view="all">The preparations of complex <ce:bold>3</ce:bold> were performed by slow evaporation technique, 35<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mL methanol/water (2:1 v/v) system were used. The obtained complexes were preliminary identified by elemental analysis. Complex <ce:bold>3</ce:bold> was obtained from methanol/water solvent system by a 1:2 stoichiometric mixtures of 1<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol (362<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mg) Fe(ClO<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>)<ce:inf loc="post">2·</ce:inf>6(H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O) and 2<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol (312<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mg) 4-4′-bipyridine. Block yellow crystals of <ce:bold>3</ce:bold> were obtained after evaporation the mixture solvent at room temperature within one week. Elemental analysis, complex <ce:bold>3</ce:bold>, Calcd. (%): C, 45.34; N, 10.57; H, 4.95. Found: C, 45.68; N, 10.31; H, 4.66. IR (KBr, cm<ce:sup loc="post">−1</ce:sup>):3386, 1595, 1537, 1488, 1403, 1319, 1220, 1108, 1058, 1045, 1000, 892, 808, 728, 622, 470 ( in Supporting information section). The thermal behaviour of complex <ce:bold>3</ce:bold> was done on a STARe System (Mettler-Toledo), <ce:float-anchor refid="f0030"></ce:float-anchor>
 shows the TG profiles of it in temperature range 50–400<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>°C. Up on heating, <ce:bold>3</ce:bold> undergo three steps of mass loss, the first mass-loss step was in the temperature range 70–100<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>°C. which is refer to the decomposition of lattice water molecules (mass loss experimental: ca. 16.75% and calc., ca. 16.98%); the second decomposition was in temperature range of 160–210<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>°C. with mass loss of ca.20.08%, which refer to the decomposition of ClO4<ce:sup loc="post">−</ce:sup> anions (calc., ca. 19.88%); the third step of mass loss was attribute to the partly decomposition of 4-4′-bipyridine molecules, in the temperature range of 270–360<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>°C. with mass loss of ca.40.02% (calc., ca. 44.19%); the residual species was stable above 360<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>°C. The PXRD pattern of crystalline samples of complex <ce:bold>3</ce:bold> was shown in .</ce:para>
clean_text:
Preparations of complex 3

The preparations of complex 3 were performed by slow evaporation technique, 35mL methanol/water (2:1 v/v) system were used. The obtained complexes were preliminary identified by elemental analysis. Complex 3 was obtained from methanol/water solvent system by a 1:2 stoichiometric mixtures of 1mmol (362mg) Fe(ClO4)2⋅6(H2O) and 2mmol (312mg) 4-4'-bipyridine. Block yellow crystals of 3 were obtained after evaporation the mixture solvent at room temperature within one week. Elemental analysis, complex 3, Calcd. (%): C, 45.34; N, 10.57; H, 4.95. Found: C, 45.68; N, 10.31; H, 4.66. IR (KBr, cm-1):3386, 1595, 1537, 1488, 1403, 1319, 1220, 1108, 1058, 1045, 1000, 892, 808, 728, 622, 470 ( in Supporting information section). The thermal behaviour of complex 3 was done on a STARe System (Mettler-Toledo),   shows the TG profiles of it in temperature range 50-400°C. Up on heating, 3 undergo three steps of mass loss, the first mass-loss step was in the temperature range 70-100°C. which is refer to the decomposition of lattice water molecules (mass loss experimental: ca. 16.75% and calc., ca. 16.98%); the second decomposition was in temperature range of 160-210°C. with mass loss of ca.20.08%, which refer to the decomposition of ClO4- anions (calc., ca. 19.88%); the third step of mass loss was attribute to the partly decomposition of 4-4'-bipyridine molecules, in the temperature range of 270-360°C. with mass loss of ca.40.02% (calc., ca. 44.19%); the residual species was stable above 360°C. The PXRD pattern of crystalline samples of complex 3 was shown in .
